channel.title: Make a Vanilla Frappachino
channel.description:
What you need:
Coffee Sugar Blender Vanilla Extract Vanilla Ice Cream Ice Milk Whip Cream (Optional) Choclate syrup (optional)
[img]http://i33.tinypic.com/2llgbpi.jpg[/img]
Now, lets brew our coffee...
[IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/23jg9s8.jpg[/img]
Now, add ice up to the 4 cup line on the blender. Add the coffee to the 3 cup line. Add milk till its the color you like it. Two scoops of Vanilla Ice Cream 1-2 tsp of Vanilla Extract 2 Tsp of Sugar
Now Blend!
[IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/1z2pv00.jpg[/img]

item.title: Make a Vanilla Frappachino
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

oksuper_:

I don’t think this is the same as Starbuck’s Vanilla Bean Frappachino… I believe that theirs has no coffee.

2/3 cup milk
2/3 cup ice
2 tablesppons General Foods International Vanilla Creme powder (coffee-free)
2 scoops of vanilla bean icecream
A sprinkle of cinnamon (optional)

Read full topic

item.title: Make a Vanilla Frappachino
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:13, topic:305373”]Congratulations on derailing your own thread. Here, have a badge.

The vanilla frappachino looks interesting, though I must say I’m not a real fan of coffee… Does it have a strong taste of coffee?[/quote]
The only way I drink coffee if it has enough sugar to cancel out the taste of the coffee.

item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

Starting up ...:

Not sure.

Lol well if they were married that’d be messed up.
Anyways, how did this topic go from Vanilla frappes to WW2??
I guess when I asked if you were German
Fun chat nontheless

item.title: Make a Vanilla Frappachino
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

Starting up ...:

Haha, well my Grandpa fought for America and my great grandpa fought for Germany… Which is weird and I don’t quite understand. My Grandma’s side is German and my Grandpa’s side is American. But idk…

Wait, so were your grandparents married? Or was your grandpa from your dads side and your grandma from your mothers side? Or vice-versa?

Read full topic

item.title: Make a Vanilla Frappachino
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

Starting up ...:

My whole family is German, except mine and my brothers generation (been in America for 20 years). So we all speak fluent English, while our generations speak no German (I wanna learn in college). My great grandma still lives in Germany, her husband started becks beer and sold it off now they are really rich. Also, one of my great grandpa’s was a Nazi (not being proud of it, just interested when I found out).

My grandpa was at war with the Germans during WW2. Then after he retired he became a medical surgeon for the army. Btw I’m Albanian and yeah it’s not a great country but that’s where I’m from.

Read full topic

item.title: Make a Vanilla Frappachino
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“Starting up …, post:5, topic:305373”][quote author=cows_be_sacred link=topic=401613.msg2978116#msg2978116 date=1254426759]
Is that orange juice on the last picture to the bottom right? OJ is the best drink imo
[/quote]Mayfield milk >.>[/quote]
Oh.
Well ontopic, I just buy 3 cold vanilla frappuccinos at drug mart or starbucks (the ones ready to go) for like $1.99 each and I drink them in the morning to wake me up. Either that or Nescafe.

Edit: If your German or Austrian your a beast, taking German atm and it’s an awesome language imo.

Read full topic

item.title: Make a Vanilla Frappachino

item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

What you need:

Coffee
Sugar
Blender
Vanilla Extract
Vanilla Ice Cream
Ice
Milk
Whip Cream (Optional)
Choclate syrup (optional)

2llgbpi.jpg922×692

Now, lets brew our coffee…

23jg9s8.jpg638×692

Now, add ice up to the 4 cup line on the blender.
Add the coffee to the 3 cup line.
Add milk till its the color you like it.
Two scoops of Vanilla Ice Cream
1-2 tsp of Vanilla Extract
2 Tsp of Sugar

Now Blend!

1z2pv00.jpg922×692
